articles.title: Leadership of women crucial to UN’s reinvention at 80, says former Assembly President
articles.summary: Since the creation of the United Nations 80 years ago, only four women have served as President of the General Assembly, where all 193 UN Member States debate the key issues facing the world.
articles.content:
On Tuesday, Germany’s Annalena Baerbock will become the first European woman to hold the post and only the fifth female President in the Assembly’s history.

On the eve of Baerbock’s inauguration, UN News spoke with one of her predecessors. María Fernanda Espinosa, a former Minister of Defence and Foreign Affairs of Ecuador, led the Assembly from 2018 to 2019 as the first woman from Latin America and the Caribbean to do so.

Hard work and skilled diplomacy

Espinosa described the General Assembly as “the laboratory of international law,” noting that the role of President demands “hard work, good diplomacy, and the ability to conduct fair negotiations.”

The last woman to preside over the Assembly said she sees in Annalena Baerbock all the qualities needed for a “brilliant performance” as the next President. She stressed that the German leader takes office at a time of “profound structural change within the institution, linked in part to financial challenges.”

Espinosa believes Baerbock will play an “absolutely central” role in implementing reforms under the UN80 process, as well as advancing commitments related to the Pact for the Future, adopted in 2024.

For Espinosa, the UN’s own history proves that it is “an irreplaceable organization, one humanity cannot do without – but which nonetheless must be reinvented.”

UN Photo/Eskinder Debebe Annalena Baerbock, President-elect of the eightieth session of the UN General Assembly, addresses the reporters following her election.

‘Why not a woman as Secretary-General?’

While welcoming the election of the Assembly’s fifth female President in New York, Espinosa said this restructuring also provides an opportunity to rethink leadership styles and to finally consider a woman for the post of Secretary-General. The next appointment is expected in 2026.

“The real question is: why not?” she asked, stressing that a woman could bring qualities such as “strong management and bridge-building.” She added that a female Secretary-General would also represent an act of “historic justice,” after 80 years of male leadership at the UN’s helm.

The former Ecuadorian diplomat acknowledged one of the UN’s biggest challenges: the gap between resolutions adopted in the General Assembly and their translation into national policies and regulations. This, she said, prevents multilateral decisions from producing tangible improvements in people’s lives.

To address this, she called for a “more inclusive and networked multilateralism,” in which citizens are informed about, engaged with, and able to monitor the international decisions being made.

Building consensus behind the scenes

Espinosa emphasized that “most of the work of the Presidency takes place behind the scenes,” dealing with divisions and forging consensus.

She noted that the incoming President will increasingly face responsibilities linked to peace and security, as well as sustainable development.

Espinosa recalled that the very first resolution adopted by the General Assembly concerned the discovery of atomic energy, underscoring the need to adapt to a new force that could be harnessed for peaceful purposes but also cause “terrible effects.”

She highlighted defining moments during her own presidency, including the difficult negotiations that led to the adoption of the first Global Compact for Migration in 2018.

The diplomat also expressed pride in internal advances, such as the decision to phase out single-use plastics at the UN, recognizing the harm they cause to human health and ecosystems.

articles.personality_title: Annalena Baerbock becomes fifth woman to lead UN General Assembly
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – The United Nations (UN) was created 80 years ago to help countries work together on global problems. Since then, only four women have ever been President of the UN General Assembly, where all 193 member countries discuss important world issues.

**What happened** – On Tuesday, Annalena Baerbock from Germany became the first European woman and only the fifth woman ever to be President of the UN General Assembly. She takes over this important role where she will lead discussions and negotiations among all the member countries.

**Impact** – Baerbock’s leadership is important because it shows progress for women in top international roles. María Fernanda Espinosa, a former President of the Assembly, said Baerbock has the skills needed to guide the UN through changes and financial challenges. This role is key for pushing reforms and new plans like the Pact for the Future, which aims to improve how the UN works.

**What's next step** – Baerbock will work on making the UN more efficient and inclusive. There is also hope that soon a woman could become the UN Secretary-General, the highest UN official, which would be a historic first. The next Secretary-General will be chosen in 2026.

**One-sentence takeaway** – Annalena Baerbock’s election as UN General Assembly President marks a step forward for women’s leadership and the ongoing renewal of the United Nations.
articles.personality_title_fr: Annalena Baerbock devient la cinquième femme à présider l’Assemblée générale de l’ONU
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – Les Nations Unies (ONU) ont été créées il y a 80 ans pour aider les pays à coopérer face aux problèmes mondiaux. Depuis, seules quatre femmes ont été présidentes de l’Assemblée générale de l’ONU, où tous les 193 États membres discutent des grandes questions internationales.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – Mardi, Annalena Baerbock, d’Allemagne, est devenue la première Européenne et la cinquième femme seulement à occuper ce poste. Elle dirigera les débats et les négociations entre tous les pays membres.

**Impact** – Sa présidence est importante car elle montre des progrès pour les femmes dans les plus hautes fonctions internationales. María Fernanda Espinosa, ancienne présidente de l’Assemblée, a souligné que Baerbock a les compétences pour guider l’ONU à travers des réformes et des défis financiers. Ce rôle est essentiel pour faire avancer des plans comme le Pacte pour l’avenir, visant à améliorer le fonctionnement de l’ONU.

**Prochaine étape** – Baerbock travaillera à rendre l’ONU plus efficace et inclusive. On espère aussi qu’une femme pourra bientôt devenir Secrétaire générale de l’ONU, ce qui serait une première historique. Le prochain Secrétaire général sera choisi en 2026.

**À retenir en une phrase** – L’élection d’Annalena Baerbock à la présidence de l’Assemblée générale marque un progrès pour le leadership féminin et le renouveau des Nations Unies.
articles.personality_title_es: Annalena Baerbock se convierte en la quinta mujer en presidir la Asamblea General de la ONU
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – La Organización de las Naciones Unidas (ONU) fue creada hace 80 años para ayudar a los países a colaborar en problemas globales. Desde entonces, solo cuatro mujeres han sido Presidentas de la Asamblea General de la ONU, donde los 193 países miembros debaten temas importantes.

**Qué pasó** – El martes, Annalena Baerbock de Alemania se convirtió en la primera mujer europea y la quinta mujer en total en ocupar este cargo. Ella dirigirá las discusiones y negociaciones entre todos los países miembros.

**Impacto** – Su liderazgo es importante porque muestra avances para las mujeres en puestos internacionales altos. María Fernanda Espinosa, ex Presidenta de la Asamblea, dijo que Baerbock tiene las habilidades necesarias para guiar a la ONU en medio de reformas y retos financieros. Este rol es clave para impulsar planes como el Pacto por el Futuro, que busca mejorar el funcionamiento de la ONU.

**Próximo paso** – Baerbock trabajará para hacer la ONU más eficiente e inclusiva. También hay esperanzas de que pronto una mujer pueda ser Secretaria General de la ONU, lo que sería un hecho histórico. El próximo Secretario General será elegido en 2026.

**Mensaje en una frase** – La elección de Annalena Baerbock como Presidenta de la Asamblea General de la ONU representa un avance en el liderazgo femenino y la renovación de la ONU.
